Line 7: Line 7:
==Safety features==
==Safety features==
â
As a safety measure designed to prevent data loss, Windows will "freeze" the entire system if the USB drive is removed, and will continue to operate immediately if the drive is inserted in the next 60 seconds after removal. If the drive is not inserted in that time-frame, the computer will shutdown after those 60 seconds to prevent possible confidential or sensitive information being displayed on the screen or stored on [[Random-access memory|RAM]].
+
As a safety measure designed to prevent data loss, Windows will "freeze" the entire system if the USB drive is removed, and will continue to operate immediately if the drive is inserted in the next 60 seconds after removal. If the drive is not inserted in that time-frame, the computer will shutdown after those 60 seconds to prevent possible confidential or sensitive information being displayed on the screen or stored on [[Random-access memory|RAM]].<ref>http://arstechnica.com/microsoft/news/2011/09/making-the-lives-of-it-easier-windows-8-refresh-reset-and-windows-to-go.ars</ref>
==Technical details==
==Technical details==
